metadata.key_specifications: Single 2-input OR gate, wide supply voltage range (2.0 V to 6.0 V), CMOS/TTL input levels, low power dissipation, high noise immunity, ESD protection up to 2000V HBM
metadata.applications: The datasheet does not explicitly mention main applications, but as a basic logic gate, the 74HC1G32/74HCT1G32 can be used in a wide range of digital circuits and systems.

page_summaries.content:
1.  General description
The 74HC1G32; 74HCT1G32 is a single 2-input OR gate. Inputs include clamp diodes. This enables the use of current limiting resistors to interface inputs to voltages in excess of VCC.

2.  Features and benefits
• Wide supply voltage range from 2.0 V to 6.0 V
• Symmetrical output impedance
• High noise immunity
• CMOS low power dissipation
• Balanced propagation delays
• Latch-up performance exceeds 100 mA per JESD78 Class II Level B
• Input levels:
• For 74HC1G32: CMOS level
• For 74HCT1G32: TTL level
• Complies with JEDEC standards:
• JESD8C (2.7 V to 3.6 V)
• JESD7A (2.0 V to 6.0 V)
• ESD protection
• HBM: ANSI/ESDA/JEDEC JS-001 class 2 exceeds 2000 V
• CDM: ANSI/ESDA/JEDEC JS-002 class C3 exceeds 1000 V
• Specified from -40° C to +85° C and from -40° C to +125° C

Product Summary.content: The 74HC1G32; 74HCT1G32 is a single 2-input OR gate. Inputs include clamp diodes, enabling the use of current limiting resistors to interface inputs to voltages in excess of VCC. It features a wide supply voltage range from 2.0 V to 6.0 V, symmetrical output impedance, high noise immunity, and CMOS low power dissipation.

The 74HC1G32; 74HCT1G32 has balanced propagation delays, latch-up performance exceeding 100 mA per JESD78 Class II Level B, and complies with JEDEC standards JESD8C (2.7 V to 3.6 V) and JESD7A (2.0 V to 6.0 V). It offers ESD protection, with HBM exceeding 2000 V and CDM exceeding 1000 V, and is specified from -40°C to +85°C and -40°C to +125°C.

The 74HC1G32 has CMOS level inputs, while the 74HCT1G32 has TTL level inputs. Both devices offer features such as symmetrical output impedance, high noise immunity, low power dissipation, balanced propagation delays, and ESD protection.

Application Circuits.content: 11.1. Waveforms and test circuit: This section likely provides information about the waveforms and test circuits used for measuring the propagation delays and switching times of the electronic component. It may include details on the input signals (A and B), output signal (Y), and the test setup for capturing these waveforms.

Fig. 4. The input (A and B) to output (Y) propagation delays: This figure illustrates the propagation delays between the input signals (A and B) and the output signal (Y). It visually represents the timing characteristics of the component, which is crucial for understanding its performance and ensuring proper operation in the application circuit.

Fig. 5. Test circuit for measuring switching times: This figure depicts the test circuit used for measuring the switching times of the electronic component. It likely shows the configuration of the test setup, including the component under test, input signal sources, and measurement equipment. Understanding the test circuit is essential for accurately characterizing the component's switching behavior and verifying its suitability for the target application.
